At-a-Glance: Good records support inspections, traceability, and claims. Log hive ID, location, queen status, brood pattern, varroa counts, feed, and treatments.
Why it Matters: Clear paperwork helps demonstrate due diligence in disease incidents or pesticide complaints.
Step-by-Step: Maintain an apiary register; record movements and splits; document treatment dates and actives; keep batch logs for honey and wax.
Common Pitfalls: Missing treatment logs, no batch codes on jars, and poor location records.
Tools & Materials: Paper logbooks or apps, waterproof labels, and a simple batch coding scheme.
